intro: Markea dressleri, commonly known as the Dressler's markea, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from pink to purple. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires a sunny to partially shaded environment. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated in gardens and greenhouses.
